resources.string: Please enter the name you want to save the current station as.
Are you sure you want to delete the station "%s"?
You need to be connected to the internet for the service alerts and next bus/train pages to work.
You already have this saved as a favorite. If you want to rename it, hit the favorites button and then click the pencil icon by the entry.
This app is still in beta and probably still has some bugs. If you have any feedback, please email helpdesk@futuresight.org.
Nearby stations (within %d meters of where you clicked)
Are you sure you want to erase everything? This means you will lose all of your settings and saved locations.

The icons used in the "Near Me" section app were taken from Flaticon.com. The base GPS pin (https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/gps-pin_8131) and bus icons (http://www.freepik.com/free-icon/front-of-bus_695855.htm) are by Freepik, the train icon is by Scott de Jonge (https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/train-on-railroad_8661), the transfer icon is made by Gregor Cresnar (https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/transfer_159791), and the star icon is by Madebyoliver (https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/star_148841).
It appears that the source of the arrival information is temporarily down. Please come back later. We apologize for the inconvenience.
What text do you want to appear on the homescreen for this shortcut?
Unfortunately, no schedule is available for this stop. We apologize for the inconvenience.
Failed to load. Click here to try again.
Failed to load stops. Try again?
Failed to load directions. Try again?
The line you were searching for was not found. That probably means it is not running today.
Failed to load lines. Try again?
Failed to load alerts. Try again?
Failed to load arrivals. Try again?

All of the relevant information in this app originates from the Greater Cleveland Regional Transit Authority (GCRTA). The arrivals information, stop lists, and map paths come from the GCRTA NextConnect service, while service alerts, system maps, and escalator/elevator statuses come directly from the GCRTA website.
Do you want to focus only on this line?
